intro: Dendrobium paucifolium, commonly known as the few-leaved orchid, is a tropical epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features a sympodial growth habit with a short, horizontal stem that produces a few leaves and flower spikes. The plant typically has narrow,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Its flowers are usually small, fragrant, and come in shades of white, yellow, and pink. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining potting media to prevent root rot.
